items.label: def-simplified-measurement-cinf
items.title: Simplified Measurement Function
items.content:
206: :label: def-simplified-measurement-cinf
207: 
208: The **simplified measurement function** d: X → ℝ depends only on position. We assume d ∈ C∞(X) with bounded derivatives:
209: 
210: $$
211: \sup_{x \in X} \|\nabla^m d(x)\| \leq C_d^{(m)} < \infty \quad \forall m \geq 0
212: $$
213: 
214: **Examples**: Distance to target set d(x) = dist(x, T) (smoothed), reward landscape d(x) = R(x), entropy proxy d(x) = -log π_ref(x).

items.label: def-localization-kernel-cinf
items.title: Localization Kernel
items.content:
224: :label: def-localization-kernel-cinf
225: 
226: The **Gaussian localization kernel**:
227: 
228: $$
229: K_\rho(r) = \exp\left(-\frac{r^2}{2\rho^2}\right)
230: $$
231: 
232: is real analytic with Hermite polynomial derivatives:
233: 
234: $$
235: \frac{d^m}{dr^m} K_\rho(r) = H_m\left(\frac{r}{\rho}\right) \cdot \rho^{-m} \cdot K_\rho(r)
236: $$
237: 
238: Derivative bounds:
239: 
240: $$
241: \left| \frac{d^m}{dr^m} K_\rho(r) \right| \leq C_{\text{Herm}} \cdot m! \cdot \rho^{-m} \cdot \exp\left(-\frac{r^2}{4\rho^2}\right)
242: $$

items.label: def-pipeline-cinf
items.title: Localized Moments, Regularized Std Dev, Z-Score, Fitness Potential
items.content:
270: :label: def-pipeline-cinf
271: 
272: **Localized mean**:
273: 
274: $$
275: \mu_\rho[f_k, x_i] = \sum_{j \in A_k} w_{ij}(\rho) \cdot d(x_j)
276: $$
277: 
278: **Localized variance**:
279: 
280: $$
281: \sigma^2_\rho[f_k, x_i] = \sum_{j \in A_k} w_{ij}(\rho) \cdot (d(x_j) - \mu_\rho)^2
282: $$
283: 
284: **Regularized standard deviation**: σ'_reg: ℝ_{≥0} → [ε_σ, ∞) satisfying:
285: 1. σ'_reg ∈ C∞ with bounded derivatives: sup_{σ²} |d^m σ'_reg / d(σ²)^m| ≤ C_{σ',m}
286: 2. σ'_reg(σ²) ≥ ε_σ > 0 (prevents division by zero)
287: 3. σ'_reg(σ²) ~ √(σ²) as σ² → ∞
288: 
289: **Z-score**:
290: 
291: $$
292: Z_\rho[f_k, d, x_i] = \frac{d(x_i) - \mu_\rho[f_k, x_i]}{\sigma'_{\text{reg}}(\sigma^2_\rho[f_k, x_i])}
293: $$
294: 
295: **Fitness potential**:
296: 
297: $$
298: V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho](x_i) = g_A(Z_\rho[f_k, d, x_i])
299: $$

items.label: def-gevrey-class-cinf
items.title: Gevrey Classes
items.content:
752: :label: def-gevrey-class-cinf
753: 
754: A function f: U → ℝ (U ⊆ ℝ^d open) belongs to **Gevrey class G^s** (s ≥ 1) if for every compact K ⊆ U, there exist C_K, A_K > 0 such that:
755: 
756: $$
757: \sup_{x \in K} \|\nabla^m f(x)\| \leq C_K \cdot A_K^m \cdot (m!)^s \quad \forall m \geq 0
758: $$
759: 
760: **Special cases**:
761: - s < 1: Real analytic (convergent Taylor series)
762: - s = 1: **Gevrey-1** (borderline, "analytic-Gevrey")
items.raw_directive:

755:

758: $$
759: 
760: **Special cases**:
761: - s < 1: Real analytic (convergent Taylor series)
762: - s = 1: **Gevrey-1** (borderline, "analytic-Gevrey")
763: - s > 1: Smooth but not analytic

items.label: def-adaptive-generator-cinf
items.title: Adaptive Langevin Generator
items.content:
825: :label: def-adaptive-generator-cinf
826: 
827: The **infinitesimal generator** of the adaptive Langevin dynamics on extended state w = (x, v):
828: 
829: $$
830: \mathcal{L} f(x, v) = v \cdot \nabla_x f + [-\nabla U(x) - \epsilon_F \nabla V_{\text{fit}}(x) - \gamma v] \cdot \nabla_v f + \frac{\gamma}{2\beta} \Delta_v f
831: $$
832: 
833: where:
834: - U(x): confining potential (backbone)
835: - ε_F ∇V_fit(x): adaptive force
836: - γ: friction
837: - Δ_v: velocity Laplacian (thermal noise)
